--- In gladiator@y..., "oldschool518" <johnnyoldschool@e...> wrote:
> i think towers and golems are good, honestly, as towers (to my best 
> recollection) are somewhat equivalent to an automated defense 
system, 
> like in Aliens, and thus can't really have great attacks or 
abilities 
> or locomotion. 

I agree that towers work like an automated defense system, but that 
does not mean it can't have multiple attack choices.  Giving them 
telekinetic abilities would be a start.  I do believe that towers 
should be able to 'activate' other team members to summon them to the 
position to prevent sneak attacks.  The other thing that would be cool 
 for is if there was an attack that went in multiple directions.

>as for golems, they get mad strong at higher levels 
> with their exploding boulders and whatnot but they still can't move 
> around so good, which could be a problem (Labyrinth). so, what to 
do. i say remove golems as they can't work good and keep towers as 
they can.


Actually, golems can be quite usefull as guardians if they had decent 
attacks and a fair amount of space to move around in.  I would propose 
giving them an attack of "Rolling ball".  Activating this attack would 
allow to roll over opponents (or trees) to cause damage.  The 
alternate would be "Return to normal", which return the Golem to 
normal.
